instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: IPad air 2 no power on
threads.message:
Hello I have a ipad air 2 come in.
Not charging and not turning on.

It was sucking .01ma to.00ma on and off.
I swapped tristar and it still doing the same thing.

anyway I found heat on <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> nd had a quick look around at the caps.
they were fine.
so I removed <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> which did not remove the short.

I found the short on the other side of nand on a cap.

My question is. <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> is a usb charging controller which I assume works with tristar.

I can't find any data sheet on it and I can't put it back on.
Can I jump McClain to the 3v3 line on pin 5 and 6
and what about pin 2 which is a 1v8 switch line.

Any help is appriciated

Thanks

threads.title: IPad air 2 no power on
threads.message: This is NOT a MacBook...probably better to post this on a different section..Why did you replace Tristar to begin with was it bad on a Tristar tester or something??? Weird for <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> to get hot unless you have a short on a line that goes to it...put <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> back. Do you have a short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_MAIN</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2R</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: IPad air 2 no power on
threads.message:
Sorry about that, wasn't sure where to post.

Short was on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_EXT_SW</SIGNAL>
I removed the short, it was <CAPACITOR>C1842</CAPACITOR>
I can not put <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> back on as it got damaged on removal.

I'm just wanting to see if it's worth ordering that chip.
Figured that <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> was a bridge, so was looking to find out what I can jump so the ipad would turn on.

I've read slot about pmic on ipad air 2 dying and not worth fixing. 
so I would like to avoid wasting anymore time and coin on it.

It showed symptoms of tristar failure.

threads.title: IPad air 2 no power on
threads.message: If that line was short, it is unlikely the PMIC is bad. That can happen but I doubt it in this case. Pull <CHIP>U8650</CHIP> from a dead donor iPad if possible

threads.title: IPad air 2 no power on
threads.message:
Thanks for info, don't have doner board.
will order one.
